result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik W. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail credit of 122 days if revoked.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 13CM1077 and 13CM1171

miscConds.notes:
plus 10% restitution surcharge.            
Per order dated  11/07/14   Restitution is now $0 - Clerk of Courts to Collect.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Not to consume/use/possess any illegal substances, street drugs, non-prescribed drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores or places where alcohol primarily is served/sold.  Not to be in a vehicle not registered to him or trespass on other people's property.
Any programming per agent.  Random testing per agent.  Pay costs of supervision.  Follow rules of probation.  Take medications as prescribed.
